title: Overview of the quarantine breach analysis
text: main dataset package quarantine_data, combines three simulation outputs COVIDQuarantine model (Lydeamore et al.) different quarantine vaccination scenarios. scenario column identifies simulation scenario (example, traveller versus worker, vaccinated versus unvaccinated), group column distinguishes travellers workers.
code: quarantine_data |> head() #>   days_infectious_community days_in_quar days_in_extended_quar #> 1                 1.4146924            4                     0 #> 2                 2.8309601            4                     4 #> 3                 0.4137212            2                     4 #> 4                 1.1789740            4                     0 #> 5                 3.8798872            4                     0 #> 6                 1.3757392            2                    14 #>   days_in_isolation t_latent t_incubation t_post_incubation time_discharged #> 1                10      0.1     4.822449          9.692244             158 #> 2                10      0.1     9.820436          9.110525             162 #> 3                10      0.1     6.466695          8.747026            1774 #> 4                10      0.1     8.001724          8.977250            1867 #> 5                10      0.1     8.858909          9.020979            2150 #> 6                 0      0.1     6.582189          8.993550            2330 #>   index_case symptomatic vaccinated compliant      FoI_max integrated_FoI #> 1          0           0          0         1 2.704994e-04   9.979526e-06 #> 2          0           0          0         1 3.691373e-01   6.508962e-02 #> 3          0           0          0         1 1.905661e+00   6.236900e-03 #> 4          1           0          0         1 1.710111e-06   4.684067e-08 #> 5          0           0          0         1 3.902629e-07   1.424251e-07 #> 6          0           0          0         1 5.485896e-01   2.072547e-02 #> #> 3 Traveller, unvaccinated traveller                NA              NA #> 4 Traveller, unvaccinated traveller                NA              NA #> 5 Traveller, unvaccinated traveller                NA              NA #> 6 Traveller, unvaccinated traveller                NA              NA #>   expressed_symptoms time_removed FoI #> 1                 NA           NA  NA #> 2                 NA title: Overview of the quarantine breach analysis
text: simple example summarising average incubation time scenario. can also visualise incubation time distribution scenario.  plot illustrates incubation time distribution shifts different assumptions vaccination whether scenario relates travellers workers.
code: quarantine_data |>   dplyr::group_by(scenario) |>   dplyr::summarise(     mean_incubation = mean(t_incubation, na.rm = TRUE),     .groups = "drop"   ) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   scenario                  mean_incubation #>   <chr>                               <dbl> #> 1 Traveller, AZ1 vaccinated            8.49 #> 2 Traveller, unvaccinated              7.73 #> 3 Worker, unvaccinated                 5.49 quarantine_data |>   ggplot2::ggplot(ggplot2::aes(x = t_incubation, fill = scenario)) +   ggplot2::geom_histogram(position = "identity", alpha = 0.4, bins = 30) +   ggplot2::labs(     x = "Incubation time (days)",     y = "Number of simulated individuals",     fill = "Scenario",     title = "Incubation time distribution by scenario"   )

title: Overview of the quarantine breach analysis
text: package also includes interactive Shiny application explore quarantine_data flexibly. app allows users filter scenario inspect incubation time distribution changes different assumptions.

title: Interactive Exploration of COVID-19 Quarantine Analysis
text: covidQuarantineViz R package turns analysis ETC5523 Assignments 1–3 interactive Shiny app reproducible code. package developed part ETC5523 Assignment 4: Turning analysis interactive. bundles simulation outputs COVIDQuarantine model provides reproducible code Shiny app analysis Assignments 1–3 can explored interactive way.

title: Interactive Exploration of COVID-19 Quarantine Analysis
Interactive Exploration of COVID-19 Quarantine Analysis
Quarantine breach risk simulations — quarantine_data
text: dataset combining three simulation outputs COVIDQuarantine model (Lydeamore et al.), representing different quarantine vaccination scenarios travellers workers hotel quarantine 14 days.

title: Quarantine breach risk simulations — quarantine_data
text: data frame one row per time point scenario. Key variables   include: scenario Simulation scenario (traveller/worker vaccination status). group Whether scenario relates travellers workers. t_incubation Simulated incubation time (days) symptom onset. ... variables original simulation outputs.

title: Quarantine breach risk simulations — quarantine_data
text: Derived three CSV files COVIDQuarantine GitHub repository   Michael Lydeamore.

title: Quarantine breach risk simulations — quarantine_data
text: row corresponds time point within simulation includes estimated breach-related quantities one scenario.
